{"step_by_step_thinking": "Yes, chimeric antigen receptor (CAR)-T cell therapies have been approved for the treatment of B cell malignancies. CAR-T cell therapy is a type of immunotherapy that involves modifying a patient's own T cells to express a chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) that targets specific proteins on cancer cells. This therapy has shown promising results in the treatment of B cell malignancies, such as certain types of leukemia and lymphoma. Several CAR-T cell therapies have received approval from regulatory authorities, including the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), for the treatment of B cell malignancies.", "answer_choice": "A"}
